structure.unit: ARTICLE C. - COUNCIL MEETINGS AND PROCEDURE
Sec. 1-1027. - MINUTES—KEEPING, RECORDING, PRESENTING FOR APPROVAL, CORRECTION.

law.catch_line: MINUTES—KEEPING, RECORDING, PRESENTING FOR APPROVAL, CORRECTION.
law.text: Minutes of all Council meetings shall be kept and recorded by the City Clerk in a permanent minute book. They shall be presented to the Council for approval. Correction of minutes of preceding meetings may be made only by a majority vote of the members of the Council present. (Code 1959 , §2-7)
